availability.p: The text of the original document is in the public domain. Subject to certain exceptions, public domain works may be freely copied or used in the creation of derivative works without permission, or authorization, of the former copyright owners.

The text encoding was created and/or prepared by the Walt Whitman Archive and is governed by a Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License (CC BY 4.0). Permission to reproduce the graphic images of the original item has been granted by the owners of the original for this publication only.

note.p: A draft of a poem later revised and published as "Shakespere-Bacon's Cipher" in 1887.

lg.head: The Mystic cipher
lg.l: All Doubtless in each and all
In book, in man the songs bequeathed—nor them alone—,—in every object.
Part All part of at each unfold‸the meaningafter the rest at the last
A mystic luring, puzzling cipher in secreted

We Dear prize! well may you rest unknowneternal source Centre and spur of science, life, love, hope
Well may ‸you rest fore'er unsolved unknown

body.note: Ms. of Walt Whitman's poem as publ'd in L of G. Fm Mildred & Frank Bain 1911 Horace Traubel
